item.title: Thoughts: Randomness Sparking My Life
item.description: Randomness Like many engineers, I like patterns and routines, but at the same time I value randomness in my life. Randomness brings momentum to life, but there is also the risk that it can threaten the normal course of life.

Ryuki Shimada I’m a Ph.D. student at Ishigami Lab., Keio University. Research Interests Path planning for a tethered mobile robot Deep reinforcement learning Cable dynamics Academic Background Sep. 2023 - current: Ph.D. course at Graduate School of Integrated Design Engineering, Keio Univerisity (Advisor: Dr. Genya Ishigami) Sep. 2021 - Sep. 2023: M.S. in Engineering, Keio Univerisity (Advisor: Dr. Genya Ishigami) Sep. 2019 - Sep. 2023: Diplôme ď’Ingénieur, Ecole Centrale de Nantes, France Apr.
